events.event_description: India overtakes China as the leading source of growth in global oil consumption.
events.citation: India has emerged as the leading source of growth in global oil consumption in 2024 and 2025, overtaking China this year, according to our December Short-Term Energy Outlook (STEO).

events.event_description: India's liquid fuels consumption is forecast to increase by 220,000 b/d in 2024 and 330,000 b/d in 2025, driven by rising demand for transportation and cooking fuels.
events.citation: Driven by rising demand for transportation fuels and fuels for home cooking, consumption of liquid fuels in India is forecast to increase by 220,000 b/d in 2024 and by 330,000 b/d in 2025.

events.event_description: China's liquid fuels consumption will grow by 90,000 b/d in 2024 and 250,000 b/d in 2025, mainly due to increased petrochemical manufacturing.
events.citation: We forecast China's liquid fuels consumption will grow by 90,000 b/d in 2024 before increasing by 250,000 b/d in 2025. Most of the growth in China is the result of increasing oil use for manufacturing petrochemicals.

events.event_description: China's total liquid fuels consumption reached 16.4 million b/d, more than triple India's 5.3 million b/d.
events.citation: Total consumption of liquid fuels in India was 5.3 million b/d in 2023, while China consumed more than triple that amount at 16.4 million b/d in 2023, based on estimates in our December STEO.
